[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The National ID and Bicycle Rental System (NIBRS) defines requirements for managing client records, bicycle reservations, rentals, and store operations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: NIBRS supports client registration, identity validation, rental tracking, and store management.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: NIBRS provides dashboards for rentals, reservations, and client records.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: NIBRS supports web and mobile access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: NIBRS uses PostgreSQL/MySQL for storage and REST APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: NIBRS secures data via HTTPS, OAuth 2.0, and JWT.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: NIBRS optimizes storage for client and rental data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: NIBRS ensures availability with real-time monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: NIBRS is configurable for stores with role-based access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: NIBRS integrates with cloud and on-premise deployments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 MISSING-TAG2: NIBRS integrates with identity verification, store, and financial systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: NIBRS is used by store managers, rental agents, and clients.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: NIBRS requires internet for ID verification and rentals.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: NIBRS depends on identity verification, financial databases, and store systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Client: User with NIN and TIN.
Bicycle: Rental unit with model and gears.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: REST API: Representational State Transfer API
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 MISSING-TAG1: NIBRS manages client registration, bicycle reservations, rentals, and store inventory.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with identity databases to validate clients.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall verify TIN through financial services.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a client registration and reservation interface (REQ-FUNC-001, REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall register clients within 2 seconds (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall check bicycle availability in 3 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store NIN, TIN, client details, bicycle models, reservations, and rentals.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure unique IDs for clients and bicycles.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall follow data protection regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log changes to inventory and orders.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall store client details, including NIN, TIN, name, and address (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall process reservations with client ID, bicycle model, type, gear count, pickup store, and date (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall log bicycle returns, including return date, store, and bicycle ID (REQ-DB-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests for registration, reservations, and data integrity.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Data protection laws, financial regulations, and ID verification standards.
